topic.title: Installing using rpm
topic.shortdesc: Install Couchbase Server on RHEL using the rpm command-line tool with the downloaded RPM package.

body.p: Only 64-bit systems are supported. See for details.
body.note: RHEL6 and other newer Linux distributions are known to have the Transparent Huge Pages (THP) feature enabled by default. THP can cause issues in database software, including Couchbase Server. THP can cause nodes to lose cluster heartbeats and auto-fail-over. Disabling THP prior to installing Couchbase Server is strongly encouraged.

section.title: Disable Transparent Huge Pages (THP)
section.p: To permanently disable both THP and THP defrag, the preferred method is to add the following to /etc/rc.local:

Alternatively, you can append the statement transparent_hugepage=never to the kernel boot line in /etc/grub.conf, which will disable THP but not THP defrag. This method can be used when it is not desirable to maintain a file /etc/rc.local.
Either method requires that you restart the operating system for changes to take effect.

section.p: After the installation is completed, use the service command to manage the Couchbase Server service, including checking the current status. Refer to the Ubuntu documentation for instructions.
To perform the initial Couchbase Server setup, open a web browser and access the Couchbase Web Console.
